text:
BEAUTIFUL FOOD COURT

This is a rather small mall along the Orchard. Linked toward Orchard MRT and Takashimaya through underpass. The young  hype and crowd is along the pass. ISETAN is the anchor here.

I like the Foods Republic food court. Beautiful interior and good selection of food choices.

Wisma Atria has been going strong since I was a child decades ago, glad to know it remains relevant and popular. Lots of retail and shopping available, with OCBC bank and a food court. Love how connected it is to public transportation especially Orchard MRT station, at the heart of Orchard Road. Will be back!

Small mall with a good food court.

A few interesting features:

Layout is pretty small with limited shops.  Foodcourt high mainly local cuisine.  A parking lot is at the top two floors which is not usual.  The OCBC branch which also has an English bookstore and gift store.

super clean toilets with many surface areas and mirrors. the vanity station is such a nice touch! however they don’t provide paper towels. hand dryer are by the sink makes so much sense. the lighting also is not glaring. 4/5 would take a poop here

Wisma Atria's a great mall on Orchard Road, you know, the fancy shopping street in Singapore.  It's got a cool glass front and you can walk right into it from the MRT station – super convenient!

Shopping there's easy:  It's got five floors, tons of stores – over 100! – with a mix of local and international brands.  You'll find familiar names like Charles & Keith and Isetan, but it's not as fancy as ION or Paragon, so it's less crowded and more relaxed.

Food's awesome too!  There's a huge food court on the fourth floor, plus some really nice sit-down restaurants and cafes.

It's easy to get around, and being connected to the MRT is a huge plus.  It's quieter than other malls, which is nice.

Overall, it might not be the fanciest, but it's a really good place to shop and eat, and it's not too hectic.
